com.vmware.vcenter.namespace_management

Interface LoadBalancers

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.vmware.vapi.internal.bindings.CompletionStageService, LoadBalancersTypes, Service
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LoadBalancersStub

    public interface LoadBalancers
extends Service, LoadBalancersTypes, com.vmware.vapi.internal.bindings.CompletionStageService
    LoadBalancers represent the user provisioned load balancers. The load balancers provided may be used to front the API servers in both, vSphere Namespaces Cluster and Tanzu Kubernetes Grid clusters. Note: The lifecycle of these load balancers is not managed by vSphere. This interface was added in vSphere API 7.0.1.0.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        LoadBalancers.GetInvocation get(java.lang.String cluster,
                                java.lang.String id)
        Returns information LoadBalancersTypes.Info about the load balancer associated with the given cluster. This method was added in vSphere API 7.0.1.0.

        Invocation Result:
        Information about load balancer associated with a cluster.

        Parameters:
        cluster - Identifier of the cluster the load balancer is associated with. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: ClusterComputeResource.
        id - Identifier of the load balancer LoadBalancersTypes.ConfigSpec.getId(). The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.namespace_management.LoadBalancerConfig.
        Returns:
        instance of LoadBalancers.GetInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described get operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.
        Throws:
        Error - if the system reports an error while responding to the request.
        NotFound - if cluster or id cannot be located.
        Unauthenticated - if the user cannot be authenticated.
        Unauthorized - if the user does not have System.Read privilege.
        Unsupported - if the specified cluster does not have vSphere Namespaces enabled.

      • list

        LoadBalancers.ListInvocation list(java.lang.String cluster)
        Returns information about all load balancers associated with the given cluster. This method was added in vSphere API 7.0.1.0.

        Invocation Result:
        List of summary of all load balancers associated with a clusters.

        Parameters:
        cluster - Identifier of the cluster the load balancers are associated with. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: ClusterComputeResource.
        Returns:
        instance of LoadBalancers.ListInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described list operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.
        Throws:
        Error - if the system reports an error while responding to the request.
        NotFound - if cluster cannot be located.
        Unauthenticated - if the user cannot be authenticated.
        Unauthorized - if the user does not have System.Read privilege.
        Unsupported - if the specified cluster does not have vSphere Namespaces enabled.

      • set

        LoadBalancers.SetInvocation set(java.lang.String cluster,
                                java.lang.String id,
                                LoadBalancersTypes.SetSpec spec)
        Applies the entire load balancer spec to an existing load balancer configuration. This method was added in vSphere API 7.0.3.0.
        Parameters:
        cluster - Identifier of the cluster the load balancer is associated with. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: ClusterComputeResource.
        id - Identifier of the load balancer. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.namespace_management.LoadBalancerConfig.
        spec - Information about the load balancer object to be set.
        Returns:
        instance of LoadBalancers.SetInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described set operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.
        Throws:
        Error - if the system reports an error while responding to the request.
        InvalidArgument - if if spec contain any errors.
        NotAllowedInCurrentState - if the associated cluster is being disabled or if the load balancer config is already marked for delete.
        NotFound - if cluster or id cannot be located.
        Unauthenticated - if the user cannot be authenticated.
        Unauthorized - if the user does not have Namespaces.Manage privilege.
        Unsupported - if the specified cluster does not have vSphere Namespaces enabled.

      • update

        LoadBalancers.UpdateInvocation update(java.lang.String cluster,
                                      java.lang.String id,
                                      LoadBalancersTypes.UpdateSpec spec)
        Updates the load balancer configuration. The specified configuration is applied partially and null fields in spec will leave those parts of configuration as-is. This method was added in vSphere API 7.0.3.0.
        Parameters:
        cluster - Identifier of the cluster the load balancer is associated with. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: ClusterComputeResource.
        id - Identifier of the load balancer. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.namespace_management.LoadBalancerConfig.
        spec - Information about the load balancer object to be updated.
        Returns:
        instance of LoadBalancers.UpdateInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described update operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.
        Throws:
        Error - if the system reports an error while responding to the request.
        InvalidArgument - if spec contains any errors.
        InvalidArgument - if if spec contain any errors.
        NotAllowedInCurrentState - if the associated cluster is being disabled or if the load balancer config is already marked for delete.
        NotFound - if cluster or id cannot be located.
        Unauthenticated - if the user cannot be authenticated.
        Unauthorized - if the user does not have Namespaces.Manage privilege.
        Unsupported - if the specified cluster does not have vSphere Namespaces enabled.
